answer:
There is no central registry of all immunizations provided in B.C.  A paper record would have been given at the time of immunization. If you no longer have a copy of all of your child's immunization records, and you require proof of immunization or immunity to vaccine-preventable diseases you can:

		Contact your local public health unit if your child was immunized at the health unit and request a copy of their immunization records. If your child was immunized in school, your local public health unit should have these records. 

		Contact your family doctor if he/she provided immunizations and request a copy of the immunization records. 
To find a public health unit near you, visit: http://immunizebc.ca/finder.
question: Where can I get a copy of the immunizations my child has received, as I don't have all of them documented in her book?
question_variation_1: where can i get copies of child immunizations
question_variation_2: can I get copy of immunizations my child has received
